intro: Phenakospermum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to various parts of Africa and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Phenakospermum species are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
